result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda M Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for Cancellation of Huber / Work Release/ Electronic Surveillance Privileges, signed and filed.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to JUDGE SIEFERT, BRANCH 47
for review. ew

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney David Del Busto.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court ordered sentence WITHHELD and placed defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
Defendant is ordered to serve 60 days of of CONDITION TIME in the House of Corrections. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work and school.
Sentence STAYED until May 24, 2017 by 5pm. 
-Defendant is to maintian absolute sobriety. 
-Defendant is to be subjected to random urine screens. 
-Defendant is have no contact with: Rodolfo G.-I.
Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.



Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney David Del Busto.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney David Del Busto.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense counsel requests discovery and offer and time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Rodolfo G.-I.; Derrick D.; Miguel D.; Tina D.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Linda M Rivera in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Justice point discharge report received and filed. lr
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Ann M Heaps in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held.  Defense awaiting additional discovery materials from the state.  Parties request for additional status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney C. McGinn for  Ann M Heaps.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Justice point report received and filed. 
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 10-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney  Colin McGinn for Ann M Heaps.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.   Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Status conference scheduled for 09-10-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Rodolfo GI; Derrick D; Miguel D; Tina D.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Linda M Rivera in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Linda M Rivera in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
